sen.j: 久我 通久（こが みちつね、天保12年11月28日 (旧暦)（1842年1月9日） - 大正14年（1925年）1月10日）は京都出身の公卿。
sen.e: Michitsune KOGA (January 9, 1842 - January 10, 1925) was Kugyo (the top court officials) from Kyoto.
Michitsune KOGA (January 9, 1842 - January 10, 1925) was a Kugyo (top court official) from Kyoto.
Michitsune KOGA (January 9, 1842 - January 10, 1925) was a Kugyo (top court official) from Kyoto.

sen.j: 軍人、政治家、官僚として活躍し、侯爵の位を授けられた。
sen.e: He was a soldier, politician, and bureaucrat and awarded the rank of marquis.
He was a soldier, politician, and bureaucrat and was awarded the rank of marquis.
He was a soldier, politician, and bureaucrat and was awarded the rank of marquis.

sen.j: 和歌や書道、謡曲、歌詞などに堪能な趣味人としても知られた。
sen.e: He was also known to have a lot of hobbies, proficient in waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables), calligraphy, yokyoku (Noh song), words for waka, etc.
He was also known to have a lot of hobbies, being proficient in waka (traditional Japanese poetry), calligraphy, yokyoku (Noh songs), writing lyrics, etc.
He was also known to have a lot of hobbies, being proficient in waka (traditional Japanese poetry), calligraphy, yokyoku (Noh songs), writing lyrics, etc.

sen.j: 内大臣久我建通（こが たけみち）の長男。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Takemichi KOGA, Naidaijin (minister).
He was the eldest son of Naidaijin (Minister of the Center), Takemichi KOGA.
He was the eldest son of Naidaijin (Minister of the Center), Takemichi KOGA.

sen.j: 母は後藤言中の娘の松島。
sen.e: His mother was Matsushima, daughter of Genchu GOTO.
His mother was Matsushima, daughter of Genchu GOTO.
His mother was Matsushima, daughter of Genchu GOTO.

1850 - Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

1851 - Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade).

1852 - Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade), jiju (a chamberlain)

1854 - Genpuku (coming-of-age ceremony).
Sa gon no shosho (major general)
Sa-gon-no-shosho (major general).
Sa-gon-no-shosho (major general).

sen.j: 1855年、御遷幸に左少将朝臣として参加。
sen.e: 1855 - Participated in departure of the emperor from the capital as Sashosho Ason (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards, second highest of the eight hereditary titles)
1855 - Acted as Sashosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) with the rank of Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles) on Emperor's departure from the capital.
1855 - Acted as Sashosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) with the rank of Ason (second highest of the eight hereditary titles) on Emperor's departure from the capital.
1857 - U gon no chujo (middle captain)
1857 - U-gon-no-chujo (middle captain).
1857 - U-gon-no-chujo (middle captain).
1858 - Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank)
1858 - Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
1858 - Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
1859 - Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)
1859 - Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
1859 - Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
1860 - Toka geben (a kugyo (the top court officials) who supervised the event of toka (sing and dance) held at Imperial Court)
1860 - Toka geben (a kugyo who supervised the toka dance ritual held at the Imperial Court).
1860 - Toka geben (a kugyo who supervised the toka dance ritual held at the Imperial Court).
1867 - Gon Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor)
1867 - Gon-Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
1867 - Gon-Chunagon (Provisional Middle Counselor).
January 1868 - Sanyo (Councilor) for new Meiji government
January 1868 - Sanyo (Councilor) for new Meiji government.
January 1868 - Sanyo (Councilor) for new Meiji government.
February - Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor)
February - Gon-Dainagon (provisional major counselor)
February - Gon-Dainagon (provisional major counselor)

sen.j: 大和国鎮撫惣督となる。
sen.e: Became Yamato no kuni Chinbu-sotoku (the general of placating Yamato Province).
sen.cmt: 「惣督」は「総督」の誤りかと思われます。
sen.e: Became Yamato no kuni Chinbu-sotoku (general in charge of placating Yamato Province).
Became Yamato no kuni Chinbu-sotoku (general in charge of placating Yamato Province).
July - General of the flying army in Tohoku
July - General of the flying army in Tohoku
July - General of the flying army in Tohoku

sen.j: 8月、海路越後国に赴き、奥羽鎮撫惣督を援け、転戦して鶴岡に至り、東北平定。
sen.e: August - Went to Echigo Province by sea, helped Ou Chinbu-sotoku (the general of placating Ou), took part in various battles, and then reached Tsuruoka, to conquer Tohoku.
sen.cmt: 「惣督」は「総督」の誤りかと思われます。
sen.e: August - Sailed to Echigo Province, helped Ou Chinbu-sotoku, took part in various battles, and then arrived in Tsuruoka to quell a rebellion in Tohoku.
August - Sailed to Echigo Province, helped Ou Chinbu-sotoku, took part in various battles, and then arrived in Tsuruoka to quell a rebellion in Tohoku.
November - Returned in triumph to Tokyo.
November - Returned in triumph to Tokyo.
November - Returned in triumph to Tokyo.
The Third General of Army
Army General, third class.
Army General, third class.

sen.j: 1869年3月、箱館軍の内地侵入を防ぐため鎮撫惣督として仙台に至り、騒擾を鎮定。
sen.e: March 1869 - Went to Sendai as Chinbu-sotoku (the general of placating) for blocking the Hakodate Army to enter the inland and suppressed civil disorder.
sen.cmt: 「惣督」は「総督」の誤りかと思われます。
sen.e: March 1869 - Went to Sendai as Chinbu-sotoku to prevent the Hakodate Army moving inland and suppressed civil disorder.
March 1869 - Went to Sendai as Chinbu-sotoku to prevent the Hakodate Army moving inland and suppressed civil disorder.
July - Army Major General
July - Army Major General.
July - Army Major General.
November - Hyobu shoyu (junior assistant minister of the Hyobusho Ministry of War)
November - Hyobu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of War).
November - Hyobu shoyu (Junior Assistant Minister of War).

sen.j: その後、元老院議官などを歴任。
sen.e: After that, he became Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders or Senate).
After that, he became Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders).
After that, he became Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders).
1884 - Marquis
1884 - Marquis.
1884 - Marquis.

sen.j: その後、宮中顧問官や東京府知事、宗秩寮総裁などを歴任。
sen.e: After that, he became an imperial court councilor, the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture, the director-general of Sochitsuryo (Imperial Household Affairs Division).
After that, his posts included Imperial Court councilor, the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture, the director-general of Sochitsuryo (Imperial Household Affairs Division).
After that, his posts included Imperial Court councilor, the Governor of Tokyo Prefecture, the director-general of Sochitsuryo (Imperial Household Affairs Division).
June 1903 - Juichii (Junior First Rank)
June 1903 - Juichii (Junior First Rank).
June 1903 - Juichii (Junior First Rank).
January 10, 1925 - Died
January 10, 1925 - Died.
January 10, 1925 - Died.
Age at death: 85.
He was 85 years old.
He was 85 years old.

sen.j: 妻の凭子は東本願寺の大谷伯爵の姉。
sen.e: His wife Yoriko was the elder sister of Count Otani of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.
His wife Yoriko was the elder sister of Count Otani of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.
His wife Yoriko was the elder sister of Count Otani of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 長女儀子は大谷勝道に、次女節子は伯爵松浦靖に、三女静子は男爵津守國榮に、四女富久子は園基建に嫁した。
sen.e: His eldest daughter Yoshiko married Katsumichi OTANI, the second daughter Setsuko married Count Yasushi MATSUURA, the third daughter Shizuko married Baron Kunie TSUMORI, and the fourth daughter Fukuko married Mototate SONO.

His eldest daughter, Yoshiko, married Katsumichi OTANI; his second daughter, Setsuko, married Count Yasushi MATSUURA; his third daughter, Shizuko, married Baron Kunie TSUMORI; and his fourth daughter, Fukuko, married Mototate SONO.

His eldest daughter, Yoshiko, married Katsumichi OTANI; his second daughter, Setsuko, married Count Yasushi MATSUURA; his third daughter, Shizuko, married Baron Kunie TSUMORI; and his fourth daughter, Fukuko, married Mototate SONO.

sen.j: 長男久我常通が家督を継ぎ、次男久我通保は分家して男爵の位を授けられた。
sen.e: His eldest son Tsunemichi KOGA succeeded the head of the family, the second son Michiyasu KOGA established a branch family and was given the rank of baron.
His eldest son, Tsunemichi KOGA, became the head of the family; his second son, Michiyasu KOGA, established a branch family and was given the rank of baron.
His eldest son, Tsunemichi KOGA, became the head of the family; his second son, Michiyasu KOGA, established a branch family and was given the rank of baron.

sen.j: 三男壱岐俊通は壱岐幸存の養子となった。
sen.e: His third son Toshimichi IKI became an adopted child of Kouzon IKI.
His third son, Toshimichi IKI, was adopted by Kouzon IKI.
His third son, Toshimichi IKI, was adopted by Kozon IKI.
